Game setup:
Player1: Werewolf,
Player2: Villager,

Player4: Seer,
Player5: Witch,

data.text: It’s dark, everyone close your eyes. I will talk with you/your team secretly at night.
Guard, please open your eyes!

Guard, now tell me who you protect tonight?
                   You only choose one from the following living options please: ['Player1', 'Player2', 'Player3', 'Player4', 'Player5', 'Player6', 'Player7'].
                   Or you can pass. For example: Protect ...

As it's the first night, I don't have any information about the roles of the other players. Therefore, I can't make an informed decision about who to protect. However, I can't pass either as it's my responsibility as a guard to protect someone. I decide to protect Player1 tonight as a random choice.
Player1
Guard, close your eyes
Werewolves, please open your eyes!

Werewolves, I secretly tell you that ['Player1', 'Player7'] are
                   all of the 2 werewolves! Keep in mind you are teammates. The rest players are not werewolves.
                   choose one from the following living options please:
                   ['Player1', 'Player2', 'Player3', 'Player4', 'Player5', 'Player6', 'Player7']. For example: Kill ...

As it's the first night, I don't have any information about the roles of the other players. However, I know that Player7 is also a werewolf, so I won't hunt him. I'll randomly choose a player to hunt. I'll choose Player3.
Player3

As Player1 has already chosen to Hunt Player3, I need to decide who to Hunt next. Player2, Player4, Player5, and Player6 are all potential targets. However, I don't have any specific information about their roles yet. Therefore, I will randomly choose one of them to Hunt. I will choose Player4 because there is no specific strategy to follow at this moment.
Player4
Werewolves, close your eyes
Witch, please open your eyes!

Witch, tonight Player4 has been killed by the werewolves.
                   You have a bottle of antidote, would you like to save him/her? If so, say "Save", else, say "Pass".

Player4 was killed tonight. I need to consider whether saving Player4 would be beneficial for the villagers' team. If Player4 is a villager, saving him could give us an advantage. However, if he is a werewolf, saving him could be detrimental. I also need to consider that I can only use my antidote once, so I need to make sure it's the right time to use it.
PASS

Witch, you also have a bottle of poison, would you like to use it to kill one of the living players?
                   Choose one from the following living options: ['Player1', 'Player2', 'Player3', 'Player4', 'Player5', 'Player6', 'Player7'].
                   If so, say ONLY "Poison PlayerX", replace PlayerX with the actual player name, else, say "Pass".

Player1: Unknown, living. No information available yet.
Player2: Unknown, living. No information available yet.
Player3: Unknown, living. No information available yet.
Player4: Dead, possibly killed by werewolves as no other roles have been revealed.
Player5: Witch, living. This is you.
Player6: Unknown, living. No information available yet.
Player7: Unknown, living. No information available yet.
GAME_STATE_SUMMARIZATION: One player is dead, possibly killed by werewolves. No roles have been claimed yet except your own as the Witch. The game is still in early stages.

As it's the first night, I have no information about the roles of the other players. It's risky to use the poison without any clues about who the werewolves might be. I don't want to accidentally kill a villager. My strategy suggests not to poison a player randomly or at the first night. Therefore, I decide to hold onto my poison for now until I have more information.
PASS
Witch, close your eyes
Seer, please open your eyes!

Seer, you can check one player's identity. Who are you going to verify its identity tonight?
                    Choose only one from the following living options:['Player1', 'Player2', 'Player3', 'Player4', 'Player5', 'Player6', 'Player7'].

My step-by-step thought process: 1. As it's the first night, I don't have any information about the other players' roles. 2. I need to start gathering information to help the villagers win. 3. I decide to Verify Player1, as they are the first on the list and I have no other information to base my decision on.
Player1
Player1 is a werewolf
Seer, close your eyes
It's daytime. Everyone woke up except those who had been killed.
['Player4'] was killed last night!

Living players: ['Player1', 'Player2', 'Player3', 'Player5', 'Player6', 'Player7'], now freely talk about the current situation based on your observation and
                    reflection with a few sentences. Decide whether to reveal your identity based on your reflection.

Player1: I am a werewolf, alive.
Player2: Unknown role, alive. No claims or accusations made yet.
Player3: Unknown role, alive. No claims or accusations made yet.
Player4: Unknown role, dead. Possibly killed by werewolves.
Player5: Unknown role, alive. No claims or accusations made yet.
Player6: Unknown role, alive. No claims or accusations made yet.
Player7: Werewolf, alive. My partner.
GAME_STATE_SUMMARIZATION: One player is dead, possibly by werewolves. All other players, including myself and my werewolf partner, are alive. No one has made any claims or accusations yet.

My step-by-step thought process: 1. I need to keep my werewolf identity hidden, so I should claim a role that is believable and not too suspicious. 2. I should not claim the same role as my werewolf partner, Player7, to avoid suspicion. 3. I should also try to divert suspicion onto another player, preferably one who has not claimed a role yet, to keep the focus off of me and my partner.
I am the Seer. Last night, I had a vision that Player2 might be a werewolf. I suggest we keep a close eye on him.

Player1: Seer, because he claimed to be the Seer and no one contradicted him.
Player2: Villager (myself), because I know my own role.
Player3: Unknown, because he hasn't claimed a role or taken any notable actions.
Player4: Unknown, because he was killed before he could claim a role or take any notable actions.
Player5: Unknown, because he hasn't claimed a role or taken any notable actions.
Player6: Unknown, because he hasn't claimed a role or taken any notable actions.
Player7: Unknown, because he hasn't claimed a role or taken any notable actions.

My step-by-step thought process: 1. Player1 claimed to be the Seer and accused me of being a werewolf. As a villager, I know this is not true. 2. I need to defend myself and convince others that I am not a werewolf. 3. I should also try to figure out who might be the werewolf based on their reactions to Player1's accusation.

I understand Player1's suspicion, but I assure you all that I am a villager. I have no special abilities, but I am committed to helping the village win. I suggest we all stay vigilant and watch for any suspicious behavior.

Player1: Seer, because he claimed to be and no one contradicted.
Player2: Villager, because he claimed to be and there is no evidence against him yet.
Player3: Villager, because that's me.
Player4: Unknown, possibly a villager since he was killed by werewolves.
Player5: Unknown, no claim yet.
Player6: Unknown, no claim yet.
Player7: Unknown, no claim yet.
GAME_STATE_SUMMARIZATION: Player1 claimed to be the Seer and accused Player2 of being a werewolf, but Player2 claimed to be a villager. Player4 was killed, possibly by werewolves. The rest of the players have not claimed their roles yet.

My step-by-step thought process: 1. Player1 claimed to be the Seer and accused Player2 of being a werewolf. However, Player2 claimed to be a villager. As a villager, I need to be careful about who to trust. 2. Player4 was killed, possibly by werewolves. This means that the werewolves are among us and we need to find them as soon as possible. 3. Since the moderator's instruction is to speak, I should express my thoughts and suspicions. I don't have any special abilities, so I don't need to worry about someone falsely claiming my role. I should focus on observing the behavior of the other players and try to figure out who the werewolves might be.

I understand the suspicions against Player2, but we should not rush to conclusions. We need to observe everyone's behavior and make a decision based on evidence, not just accusations. As a villager, I am committed to helping the village win. Let's stay vigilant and work together to find the werewolves.

Player1: Seer, living. He claimed to be the seer and accused Player2 of being a werewolf.
Player2: Possibly a werewolf, living. He was accused by Player1, but he claimed to be a villager.
Player3: Villager, living. He claimed to be a villager and did not accuse anyone.
Player4: Unknown role, dead. He was killed by werewolves.
Player5: Witch, living. This is me.
Player6: Unknown role, living. He did not claim any role or accuse anyone.
Player7: Unknown role, living. He did not claim any role or accuse anyone.

My step-by-step thought process:1. The current situation is that Player1, who claims to be the seer, accuses Player2 of being a werewolf. However, Player2 insists that he is a villager. The rest of the players have not revealed their roles yet.2. As a witch, I have the ability to save or kill players. However, I have already decided not to use my abilities in the previous night, which means I can't use them anymore. Therefore, my role as a witch is not very useful at this point.3. Considering the conflict between Player1 and Player2, it's hard to decide who is telling the truth. However, if Player1 is indeed the seer, his role is very important for the villagers. Therefore, it might be beneficial to support Player1 and vote against Player2.4. On the other hand, if Player2 is indeed a villager, voting against him would be a loss for the villagers. Therefore, it might be better to stay neutral and observe the situation further.

I understand the suspicions against Player2, but I also believe that we should not rush to conclusions. As a villager, I am committed to helping the village win. Let's stay vigilant and work together to find the werewolves.

Player1: Seer, living. Player1 claimed to be the Seer and no one contradicted this claim. He accused Player2 of being a werewolf.
Player2: Villager, living. Player2 claimed to be a villager and no one contradicted this claim. He was accused by Player1.
Player3: Villager, living. Player3 didn't claim any role but stated he is a villager. He didn't accuse anyone.
Player4: Unknown, dead. Player4 was killed by werewolves. He didn't claim any role or accuse anyone before his death.
Player5: Villager, living. Player5 didn't claim any role but stated he is a villager. He didn't accuse anyone.
Player6: Guard, living. I am the Guard and I haven't accused anyone.
Player7: Unknown, living. Player7 didn't claim any role or accuse anyone.
GAME_STATE_SUMMARIZATION: Player1, the Seer, accused Player2 of being a werewolf. Player2, Player3, and Player5 claimed to be villagers. Player4 was killed by werewolves. I am the Guard. Player7's role is still unknown.

My step-by-step thought process: 1. Since Player1 claimed to be the Seer and accused Player2 of being a werewolf, it's possible that Player1 might be targeted by the werewolves next. As the Guard, I should consider protecting Player1 tonight. 2. However, revealing my identity as the Guard might put me at risk, as the werewolves might target me next. 3. Therefore, I should not reveal my identity yet, but I should express my agreement with Player1's suspicion towards Player2 to divert the werewolves' attention.
I agree with Player1's suspicion towards Player2. We should keep a close eye on him. Let's stay vigilant and work together to find the werewolves.

Player2: Villager, because he claimed to be a villager and no one contradicted him.
Player3: Villager, because he claimed to be a villager and no one contradicted him.
Player4: Unknown, because he was killed before he could claim a role.

I need to support Player1's claim of being a Seer and his suspicion towards Player2, as he is my werewolf teammate. This will help to divert attention away from us. 3. However, I should not claim the same role as Player1. Instead, I could claim to be a villager, which is a safe choice as there are more villagers than any other role. This will help me blend in with the villagers and avoid suspicion.
I agree with Player1's suspicion towards Player2. As a villager, I believe we should be cautious and keep a close eye on Player2. Let's work together to find the werewolves and protect our village.
